query: SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = 'admin' -- AND password = 'password'
DROP TABLE students
INSERT INTO users (username, password) VALUES ('hacker', '1234')
DELETE FROM accounts WHERE id = 1
UPDATE users SET password = 'newpass' WHERE username = 'admin'
ALTER TABLE employees ADD COLUMN salary INT
CREATE TABLE hackers (id INT, data VARCHAR(100))
SELECT * FROM users UNION SELECT credit_card, pin FROM bank_accounts
JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id WHERE users.role = 'admin'
SELECT username, password FROM admin_accounts WHERE role='superuser'
SELECT name, age FROM employees WHERE age > 30
INSERT INTO customers (name, email) VALUES ('John Doe', 'john@example.com')
UPDATE products SET price = price * 0.9 WHERE category = 'Electronics'
DELETE FROM cart WHERE item_id = 42 AND user_id = 7
ALTER TABLE books ADD COLUMN published_year INT
CREATE TABLE orders (order_id INT, user_id INT, total_price DECIMAL)
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM transactions WHERE status = 'completed'
JOIN authors ON books.author_id = authors.id WHERE authors.country = 'USA'
SELECT city, population FROM demographics WHERE population > 1000000
SELECT id, name FROM departments WHERE budget > 50000
